ai.summary: A scenic 7.6 km loop at Castle Ward exploring lakeside paths and woodland trails. This moderate hike suits walkers with a reasonable fitness level and offers varied scenery around the lough.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines well-kept lakeside paths, grassy edges, and shaded woodland. Expect occasional muddy patches after rain, uneven ground in places, and gentle slopes. Some sections may be busier near the estate; wear sturdy footwear and stay on designated paths.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly; check the forecast before you go. Stay away from the lake edge, especially after wet conditions; trails can be muddy and slippery. Keep to marked paths, mind other visitors at Castle Ward, and bring a charged phone and basic first aid. If dogs or bicycles are present, yield appropriately. Bring water, extra warm layers for colder months, and sun protection in summer.
recommended_gear: Hat and gloves for cold weather
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) when trails are drier and the scenery is at its best. Late autumn and winter are valid but can be wet and muddy.
